versions.name: GCP Virtual Private Cloud Route Creation v102.0.0
versions.description: Identifies when a virtual private cloud (VPC) route is created in Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Google Cloud routes define the paths that network traffic takes from a virtual machine (VM) instance to other destinations. These destinations can be inside a Google VPC network or outside it. An adversary may create a route in order to impact the flow of network traffic in their target's cloud environment.
author: Elastic
false_positives: Virtual Private Cloud routes may be created by system administrators. Verify that the configuration change was expected. Exceptions can be added to this rule to filter expected behavior.
versions.setup: The GCP Fleet integration, Filebeat module, or similarly structured data is required to be compatible with this rule.
